donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
outputs.output_descr: National Institutions utilize Results-Based Management  (RBM) systems for planning, monitoring and evaluation to enhance ownership and leadership for achievemnet of development results. RBM Practices will be the strategy through which the Joint Programme will ensure that the planning, management, monitoring, evaluation, reporting and accountability arrangements focus on results. RBM will be embedded in all activities supported through the programme.

The support under this output will be geared towards improving alignment of policies, programmes and budgets with national development strategy and the MDGs on the basis of a comprehensive RBM Manual agreed with all stakeholders. On this basis project planning, appraisal, M&E, budget and aid policy guidelines and procedures will be updated in order to ensure an integrated and results oriented national planning and M&E system that uses the MTEF as a tool to help Government shape its budget in line with its development objectives

This output is intended to implement activities that complement the the first two Outputs, but focusing specifically on strengthening the coordination role of the Debt and Aid Division (DAD) under MoF. The focus will be on the provision of capacity building support for strengthening debt and aid management functions, aid and debt policy and strategy formulation, improved preparations for Common Approach to Budget Support (CABS) group meetings and High Level Forum (HLF) dialogue, and stakeholder engagement, sensitization and education activities targeting a broad range of actors.

Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Economic Planning and Office of the President and Cabinet have been assessed as having sufficient capacities to implement the project. Support will be provided to ensure effective and efficient delivery of results, timely preparation of annual work plans and budgets and Joint Programme Steering Committee (JPSC), Programme Management Coordination (PMC) and Technical Working Group (TWG) meetings, as well as mid-and end-term evaluation and required audits.

project_descr: Public institutions are better able to manage, allocate and utilize resources for effective development and service delivery by 2016
